intro: Metrosideros linearifolia, commonly known as the coastal rata, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows in coastal and lowland areas. The plant produces striking red or orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, and it has a fibrous root system adapted to coastal conditions. The wood of Metrosideros linearifolia is lightweight and has been historically used by Māori for various purposes.
